section: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Sponsor shall also be fully responsible for, the management of the Trust's assets including rendering of investment advice and supervision with respect thereto or the distribution of shares of any series, nor shall the Sponsor be deemed to have assumed or have any responsibility with respect to functions specifically assumed by any transfer agent, custodian, fund accounting pricing agent or shareholder servicing agent of the Trust.
explanation: The sentence structure is flawed and creates ambiguity. The phrase 'the Sponsor shall also be fully responsible for...the distribution of shares of any series' is confusing because it is negated by the 'Notwithstanding the foregoing' clause. It's unclear whether the Sponsor is responsible or not for these activities. It appears to be written that the sponsor shall NOT be responsible for the management of the Trust's assets.

section: The Sponsor shall be liable for any error of judgment or mistake of law or for any act or omission in the oversight, administration or management of the Trust or the performance of its duties hereunder, except for willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence in the performance of its duties, or by reason of the reckless disregard of its obligations and duties hereunder.
explanation: This section attempts to limit the Sponsor's liability but the wording is contradictory. It states the Sponsor is liable for 'any error of judgment or mistake of law' but then excludes liability for 'willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence...or by reason of the reckless disregard of its obligations'. Willful misfeasance, bad faith and gross negligence can all be considered errors of judgment or mistakes of law. This creates an in-text contradiction.

section: This Agreement may be terminated at any time, without the payment of any penalty, with respect to any series or the Trust, by the Board of Trustees of the Trust, or by the Sponsor, in each case on not less than 60 days' written notice to the other party.
explanation: The phrase 'with respect to any series or the Trust' is ambiguous. Does this mean the agreement can be terminated for one series while remaining active for others, or does it mean the entire agreement can be terminated? This lack of clarity creates potential disputes over the scope of termination.
